name: Vegan Red Bell Pepper Pasta
description: This vegan red bell pepper pasta is super easy to make and it's SO comforting! The sauce is packed with flavor and it's incredibly creamy. I love serving it with fettuccine and sprinkle it with fresh parsley and red pepper flakes
recipeIngredient: 1 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk ((make sure the milk you use is unsweetened) )

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F. Cut the red bell peppers and the onion into stripes. Together with the garlic, place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 °F. Cut the red bell peppers and the onion into stripes. Together with the garlic, place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, cook the fettuccine according to the instructions on the package. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, cook the fettuccine according to the instructions on the package. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Get the bell pepper, the onion, and the garlic out of the oven and place them in a high speed blender together with the remaining ingredients and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Get the bell pepper, the onion, and the garlic out of the oven and place them in a high speed blender together with the remaining ingredients and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the red bell pepper sauce into a saucepan and heat it up for a couple of minutes. Stir in the cooked fettuccine and serve immediately. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley and more red pepper flakes if you like. Enjoy!
